VJoy

Class VJoyDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • VJoy.VJoyDriver
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    VJoyDriver32, VJoyDriver64

    public class VJoyDriver
extends Object
    Class handling the interaction with VJoy driver and, subsequently, with virtual gamepads created by it. It uses JNA to create interface that maps functionality of VJoy dll and allows for its use in Java. NOTE: You should use either 32 or 64-bit version of this class, depending on the OS.
    Author:
    Lucjan Koperkiewicz

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  VJoyDriver.VJoy32

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      VJoyDriver(boolean autoInit)
      Creates new VJoyDriver containing necessary interfaces required for handling virtual gamepad and optionally immediately initializes it (recommended).

    • Constructor Detail

      • VJoyDriver

        public VJoyDriver(boolean autoInit)
        Creates new VJoyDriver containing necessary interfaces required for handling virtual gamepad and optionally immediately initializes it (recommended). NOTE: You should create either 32 or 64-bit version of this class, depending on the OS.
        Parameters:
        autoInit - if true it will automatically initialize driver and start reinitialization thread. Otherwise it will require manual startup at a later time - see VJoyStart

    • Method Detail

      • VJoyStart

        public void VJoyStart()
        Initializes the driver and starts reinitialization thread.

      • VJoyInit

        public void VJoyInit()
        Initializes the driver from appropiate dll in \dll\ directory.

      • buttonPress

        public boolean buttonPress(int buttonNumber)
        Simulates press of the button with given number on virtual gamepad. Supports buttons from 1 to 24. The pressed button will remain pressed until its release - see buttonRelease
        Parameters:
        buttonNumber - number of button to press
        Returns:
        true if button was pressed successfully, false if not

      • buttonRelease

        public boolean buttonRelease(int buttonNumber)
        Releases previously pressed button.

        If button was not pressed it does nothing.

        Parameters:
        buttonNumber - number of button to release
        Returns:
        true if button was released successfully, false if not

      • updateButtons

        public boolean updateButtons()
        Updates the current state of buttons, reflecting it in virtual gamepad. It is called automatically by functions responsible for changing buttons' state, but if such a need arises, it can be called to fix potential stuck buttons.
        Returns:
        true if driver updated successfully, false if not

      • updateAxes

        public boolean updateAxes(int axisNr,
                 int cordX,
                 int cordY)
        Changes the state of chosen analog stick axisNr to coordinates of cordX, cordY. The stick will remain in such state until it's changed again, so it is important to remember that returning it to neutral position requires calling this function with (cordX,cordY)=(0,0).
        Parameters:
        axisNr - the number of analog stick updated. It is 1 for the left stick and 2 for right stick.
        cordX - the new X position of stick. It is contained in range from -127 to -127, with 0 being central neutral position
        cordY - the new Y position of stick. It is contained in range from -127 to -127, with 0 being central neutral position
        Returns:
        true if analog stick updated successfully, false if not

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the driver and its actions.
